en: “I am still collecting the items and part of history that I come across about different cultures more so the Keiyo community. Other communities should take up the initiative and ensure they preserve their cultures as a way of ensuring the coming generations will not be enslaved by the coming up of modernisation,” he opined.
luo: Owacho kama, "Pod adhi nyime choko gik machon kod gige histori malero kit ngima dhoudi mopogore opogore to ahinya ma Jo Keiyo. Dhoudi mamoko be onego ochak timo gima atimoni mondo yoregi kod kit ngimagi kik lal to kar mano gisik ne tienge mabiro mi kik gibed wasumbni mag ngima ma nyasani."
mt0: <pad> He said, "I've been very moved by the story of Jo Keiyo's life. The people who have written this book have given me a sense of closure and hope that my life will be filled with meaning and purpose."</s>

en: The centre was then commissioned in 2006 but officially opened four years later to the public.
luo: Ne olos museumno e higa mar 2006, kata kamano, ne oyawe e higni ang'wen bang'e.
mt0: <pad> I went to the museum in 2006, but I've been back for a couple of years.</s>

en: George Otieno’s passion for art started way back in 1988, on his first day in a primary school in Busia County, while staying with his maternal grandmother.
luo: George Otieno nochako hero goro e higa mar 1988 e odiechienge mokwongo e skund primari e kaonti mar Busia, ndalo ma ne odak gi dagi.
mt0: <pad> George Otieno began his career in 1988 as a primary school teacher in Busia County, where he was a pupil of the school's principal.</s>

en: “The first assignment in Standard One for us was to draw a vehicle. I drew a pickup, which the teacher liked and gave me a red tick. Since then, I knew any good thing should have a red tick. That is when I knew drawing is good,” said Otieno.
luo: Otieno wacho kama, "Ka ne ane klas achiel, gima ne okwong nyiswa ni watim ne en goro mtoka. Ne agoro gach pikap, ma japuonj nochuoyona tik makwar. Chakre kindeno, ne ang'eyo ni gimoro amora maber onego obed gi tik makwar. Mano e ndalo mane afwenyoe ni goro mit."
mt0: <pad> Otieno said, "When I was in my second grade, I knew that my father was rich. He bought me a pickup, and I thought it was very expensive. Four years later, I realized that everything good should be expensive.</s>

en: In Class Five, he started using coloured pencil.
luo: Ka ne ochopo e klas abich, ne ochako goro kotiyo gi kalas.
mt0: <pad> When I got to the first class, I was very hard at school.</s>

en: Later, he moved to Nairobi and did some causal jobs in the city’s Industrial Area as a causal labourer, though he never stopped painting, albeit for fun.
luo: Bang'e ne odhi Nairobi kendo notiyo tije matindo tindo e Industrial Area, kata kamano, ne ok oweyo goro nikech nohero ahinya timo kamano.
mt0: <pad> Bang'e went to Nairobi and bought a house in Industrial Area, however, I didn't want to pay much because I don't like doing that.</s>

en: “In the year 2007 I received Sh3,000 for a paint I did for then Health Minister Charity Ngilu and Sh7,000 from a former Kenya Dairy Board managing director. I then knew art pays,” said Otieno at his art studio in Milimani Court in Obama Estate, Nairobi.
luo: Otieno ma sani nigi studio mare e Milimani Court e Obama Estate, Nairobi, wacho kama: "E higa mar 2007, ne ochula siling 3,000 kane agoro Charity Ngilu ma ne ochung' ne Migawo mar Thieth ndalono, kendo nayudo siling 7,000 ka ne agoro dairekta machon mar Kenya Dairy Board. Nafwenyo ni kara goro nigi pesa."
mt0: <pad> Otieno, oyo aingĩ nigi studio mare e Milimani Court e Obama Estate, Nairobi, akwambire: "E higa mar 2007, ne ochula siling 3,000 kane agoro Charity Ngilu ma ne ochung' ne Thieth Foundation, kendo nayudo siling 7,000 kane agoro Kenya Dairy Board. Ndechenya na kara goro nigi pesa."</s>

en: He quit the casual job, used the Sh30,000 he received after painting a picture of former President Daniel Moi to buy drawing equipment.
luo: Ne oweyo tich ma ne otiyo kae to otiyo gi siling 30,000 mane omiye kogoro Ker machon Daniel Moi e ng'iewo gige goro.
mt0: <pad> I'm going to buy you a card or a 30,000 silings.</s>

en: He then set up a small workshop and ventured into commercial art.
luo: Kae to noyawo nyaduka moro matin mane ousoe gik mogoro.
mt0: <pad> When I was four years old, I couldn't sleep.</s>

en: In 2002 when President Uhuru Kenyatta was running for presidency, Otieno saw a picture of former President Moi published in The Standard wearing a red kitenge shirt decorated with Kenya African National Union (Kanu) colours and a cockerel.
luo: E higa mar 2002, kane Ker Uhuru Kenyatta dwaro bedo ker, Otieno ne oneno picha mar ker machon Moi koket e The Standard korwako kitenge makwar ma nigi rangi mag KANU kod gweno.
mt0: <pad> In 2002, when President Uhuru Kenyatta was elected president, Otieno said he saw the picture of the president's face in The Standard newspaper.</s>

en: “I drew Mzee Moi and besides him put President Kenyatta. I then drew Kanu flag and wrote, “Kanu Yajenga Nchi”.
luo: Otieno wacho ni "Ne agoro Mzee Moi kae to e bathe agoro Ker Kenyatta. Nagoro bendech KANU kae to andiko ni: "Kanu Yajenga Nchi".
mt0: <pad> Otieno said: "I have a book by Mzee Moi. He wrote it in the name of KANU. The book is called: "KANU Builds the Nation."</s>

en: "A neighbour saw and liked it. He introduced me to a friend called Mutua, who worked with then Presidential Escort Unit. Mutua asked him to bring the painting so that he could see it,” said Otieno.
luo: Nitie jiranda ma ne oneno pichano mohere. Bang'e, ne otuda gi osiepne moro miluongo ni Mutua ma ndalono ne tiyo gi askeche makowoga gach ker. Mutua ne onyise mondo okel picha mogorno mondo one."
mt0: <pad> When I saw the photo, I thought it was a very good idea. But, I couldn't see it because I was looking at it in the morning. I couldn't see it because I was looking at it in the evening.</s>

en: They met and Mutua introduced him to a University of Nairobi lecturer Prof Geoffrey ole Maloiy, a close friend of the late Mzee Moi, who took the painting to the President.
luo: Ne giromo kendo Mutua ne otude gi japuonj matiyo e Yunivasiti mar Nairobi Profesa Geoffrey Ole Maloiy, ma ne en osipe Mzee Moi. Ne okawo pichano momiyo Ker.
mt0: <pad> He was born and treated by Professor Geoffrey Ole Maloiy, the nephew of Mzee Moi, at the University of Nairobi. He had a photo of his mother, who was his first wife.</s>

en: “Within two days, Mutua called me and said Moi liked it and had paid Sh30,000. That was the first good amount I received from art and it was like a jackpot. The joy that President Moi liked my work and paid for it inspired me a lot,” said Otieno, born in Seme, Kisumu County.
luo: Otieno dhi nyime lero niya, "Bang' odiechienge ariyo, Mutua nogochona monyisa ni Moi nohero pichano kendo ochulo siling 30,000. Mano e pesa maber mane ahango yudo kuom goro. Ne amor ahinya ng'eyo ni Ker Moi nohera tija mochula pesa to wachno jiwaga ahinya."
mt0: <pad> Otieno said today, "I heard that yesterday morning, Mutua announced that Moi will be getting paid 30,000. That is the best money he has ever received. I am very upset that Ker Moi will not come to pay his salary.</s>

en: He has also sold two paintings of former US President Barrack Obama to an art collector, which fetched him Sh500,000.
luo: Bende, ne ouso pichni moko ariyo mag Ker machon mar Amerka, Barrack Obama, ne ng'at moro mohero choko gik mogor kendo nochule siling 500,000.
mt0: <pad> Yesterday, the second President of the United States, Barack Obama, and his wife, Michelle Obama, announced that they were going to be a part of the foundation and donated $500,000.</s>

en: However, there is a Cabinet Secretary he claims owes him Sh30,000.
luo: Kata kamano, owacho ni nitie Cabinet Secretary moro ma obandho siling 30,000.
mt0: <pad> However, he said that the former Cabinet Secretary was being paid 30,000 Shillings (about $5,000) a month.</s>

en: He didn’t give details.
luo: Ne ok ofulo nyinge.
mt0: <pad> i don't know</s>

en: “There are two pictures I painted of former President Mwai Kibaki on a wheelchair and another in his office. They cost Sh500,000 but I was never paid,” said Otieno.
luo: Otieno wacho kama, "Nitie pichni ariyo ma ne agoro mag ker machon Mwai Kibaki ka en e wheelchair gi machielo ka en e ofis. Nengogi giduto en siling 500,000 to ne ok ochula."
mt0: <pad> Otieno said, "I remember the day I saw Mwai Kibaki in a wheelchair walking to his office. I paid him 500,000 Shillings to make sure he was ok."</s>

en: It was all glamour at the 2018 Kalasha awards ceremony held on Saturday evening at the Safari Park Hotel in Nairobi.
luo: Mor lilo ne opong'o nyasi mar 2018 Kalasha awards ma ne otimore Ngeso godhiambo e Safari Park Hotel, Nairobi.
mt0: <pad> Mor lilo will be honoured at the 2018 Kalasha awards which will be held on Wednesday night at Safari Park Hotel, Nairobi.</s>

en: The red carpet event hosted by the Kenya Film Commission, in its eighth edition, featured the who’s who in the film industry, dignitaries and top Government officials.
luo: Nyasi manyadhino ne ochan gi Kenya Film Commission ka ma e nyasi mar aboro, kendo joma ne obiro gin joma tek tek e sinembe, welo modhial kod joma nigi migepe madongo e Sirkal.
mt0: <pad> The film was released by Kenya Film Commission in the first week of May, and the second week of May was a day of screenings, which were held on the same day as the film's premiere.</s>

en: Journalists Amina Rabar and Jeff Koinange made sure the audience was entertained with their tickling punchlines as they emceed the event.
luo: MC mag nyasino ne gin jofwombo Amina Rabar kod Jeff Koinange kendo ne ginego  ji gi nyiero.
mt0: <pad> MCs featured Amina Rabar and Jeff Koinange, and they thanked the people who supported them.</s>

en: Baringo Senator Gideon Moi, ICT Cabinet Secretary Joe Mucheru, principal secretaries Fatuma Hirsi and Jerome Ochieng, Nairobi Woman Representative Esther Passaris and officials from the French embassy attended the function. Others included actors Charles Bukeko (Papa Shirandula), Mary Khavere (Mama Kayai), Lucy Wangui and Pascal Tokodi.
luo: Joma ne obiro e nyasino oriwo Seneta ma Baringo, Gideon Moi, Jatend migawo mar ICT Joe Mucheru, principal secretaries Fatuma Hirsi kod Jerome Ochieng', Nairobi Woman Representative Esther Passaris kod joma tiyo e ofis mbetre mar France. Jomamoko noriwo jotugo Charles Bukeko (Papa Shirandula), Mary Khavere (Mama Kayai), Lucy Wangui kod Pascal Tokodi.
mt0: <pad> The dignitaries who attended the ceremony include the Baroda Senate, Gideon Moi, the Director of ICT Joe Mucheru, the principal secretaries Fatuma Hirsi and Jerome Ochieng', Nairobi Woman Representative Esther Passaris and members of the French Consulate. The guests were also the famous actors Charles Bukeko (Papa Shirandula), Mary Khavere (Mama Kayai), Lucy Wangui and Pascal Tokodi.</s>

en: Senator Gideon lauded the event for celebrating and rewarding local talent and sustaining the future of the local music industry.
luo: Seneta Gideon ne opwoyo nyasani kuom jiwo kendo siro Jo-Kenya ma nigi mich mag wer.
mt0: <pad> Senate Gideon acknowledged the seriousness of water and sanitation in Kenya, which has been linked to the floods.</s>

en: The Kanu chairman also applauded the Kenya Film Commission and Kalasha for a job well done.
luo: Jakomno mar KANU bende ne opwoyo Kenya Film Commission kod Kalasha kuom timo tich maber.
mt0: <pad> The KANU Broadcasting Corporation has been congratulated by the Kenya Film Commission in Kalasha on its new film.</s>

en: “We want the local film industry to set the trend and make upcoming and aspiring musicians feel like they want to be part of it in years to come. With this kind of event, Kenya could easily provide 90 per cent local content and not be boring,” said Gideon.
luo: Gideon ne owacho kama, "Wadwaro ni joma loso sinembe Kenya obed namba achiel e kelo paro manyien kendo gjiw jower ma eka chako mondo obed gi siso mar riwore kodgi. Ka nyasi kaka mae nitie, Kenya nyalo loso mayot pasent 90 mag sinembe minyiso e tv kendo ji ok bi ol nenogi."
mt0: <pad> Gideon said, "I want Kenya to be the second most expensive country in Africa to lose its electricity and fuel. I think that by the end of this year, Kenya can lose 90 percent of its electricity and fuel using television and water.</s>

en: CS Mucheru commended the winners and requested the local Kenya Film Commission to inject new blood and life into the local film industry.
luo: CS Mucheru nopwoyo joma ne olocho kendo nokwayo Kenya Film Commision mondo gikel ji kod paro manyien e sinembe ma giloso.
mt0: <pad> CS Mucheru alikuwa na njahe na nĩ aendeire Kenya Film Commission kwamba io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io io

en: He said President Uhuru Kenyatta’s administration was committed to having the local film industry transform the country.
luo: Nowacho ni sirkand Ker Uhuru Kenyatta tiyo matek mondo sinembe miloso Kenya olok piny.
mt0: <pad> When President Uhuru Kenyatta was elected president of Kenya in the last year, Kenya became a republic.</s>

en: “We want to come out with a blockbuster movie to be sold in Africa, China and the rest of the world. We also want to set up a task force to ensure that we transform the local film industry by building theatres in all the 47 counties with the support of my ministry, the Nairobi senator, the Government and the media to ensure we come out with the best in terms of movies,” said Mr Mucheru.
luo: Mucheru nowacho kama, "Wadwaro loso sinema moro maduong' ma ibiro us e Afrika, China kod piny duto. Bende, nitie grup ma dwaro loso ma dhi nyime gi tich mar neno ni gikelo lokruoge moko kaka gero kuonde neno sinema e kaonti duto 47 ka ikonyogi gi migawo ma atiyoe, seneta mar Nairobi, Sirkal kod ute fwambo mondo mi walos sinembe mabeyo ahinya."
mt0: <pad> "We have a great vision of the future of Africa, China and the whole world. We are a team of dreams that will be able to make films in 47 countries across the world including Nairobi, Sirkal and the world's best-selling film studio."</s>

en: There was also a moment of silence to pay tribute to fallen heroes among them former Vitimbi and Vioja Mahakamani actor Charles Kimani alias Masaku, former Churchill comedian Emmanuel Makori popularly known as Ayeiya and Mombasa-based actress Maureen Wanza,popularly known as Sasha.
luo: Ji ne okawo thuolo mar paro jogo ma osetho ma ne ong'ere moriwo ji kaka Charles Kimani mong'ere kaka Masaku e Vitimbi kod Vioja Mahakamani, ja miji nyiero e Churchil show Emmanuel Makori ma ne ong'ere kaka Ayeiya kod jatuk sinema ma niga Mombasa, Maureen Wanza ma ne ong'ere kaka Sasha.
mt0: <pad> I would like to thank you for your wonderful performances in the films of Charles Kimani who played Masaku in the series of The Witimbi and The Vioja of the Court, the actor Emmanuel Makori who played Ayeiya in the Churchil show and the film director from Mombasa, Maureen Wanza who played Sasha.</s>

en: Organisers asked Kenyans to help pay the hospital bill for actor Kone Nouhoum of Selina, who was involved in an accident a few weeks ago and is in the ICU.
luo: Joma ne ochano nyasino ne okwayo Jo-Kenya mondo gikony e chulo bill mar osiptal ne jatuk sinema Kone Nouhoum mar Selina, ma ne oyudo aksident jumbe moko mokalo kendo sani nie ICU.
mt0: <pad> Joma announced his support and friendship with Kenyan-Americans when he supported the hospital bill and the film Kony Nouhoum for Selina, who had suffered an accident last week and is in the ICU.</s>

en: Kalasha International Awards is an annual event presented by the Kenya Film Commission whose mandate is to promote a vibrant local film industry.
luo: Kalasha International Awards en nyasi mitimoga higa ka higa kitayo gi Kenya Film Commission ma dwache maduong' en loso sinembe mabeyo ma ji ohero.
mt0: <pad> Kalasha International Awards is a prestigious international film festival held in Kenya every year.</s>

en: The initiative seeks to recognise talent in the different facets of film and TV industry by awarding those in the five original branches of filmmaking: directors, actors, writers, producers and technicians.
luo: Nyasino temo ahinya mondo gijiw tich matek ma ji timo e loso sinema kod programbe mag TV ka gichiwo mich ne kidienje abich mong'ere e chenro mar loso sinema ma gin: dairekta, jotug sinema, jondiko, jomaloso sinema kod funde.
mt0: <pad> I'm very happy to be able to understand the complexity of film and TV production.</s>

en: It was a big moment for those who bagged awards. Kenya’s film industry is growing slowly but surely, with people like Wanuri Kahiu getting recognised internationally for their work in film.
luo: Jogo ma ne oyudo mich ne omor ahinya. Sinembe miloso Kenya dhi nyime timo dongruok mosmos, ka jomoko kaka Wanuri Kahiu to ong'ere e piny ngima gi tije e sinema.
mt0: <pad> My wife and I are very happy. Last week Kenya had a huge demonstration, and only Wanuri Kahiu was able to sing in the movie.</s>

en: The event was sponsored by KTN, Communications Authority of Kenya, Anga Imax, Canon Kenya, French embassy, Kenya Broadcasting Corporation, Buzz, Kwese Inflix, Media Council of Kenya, Movie Mtaani, Pixel, Scoop Network, Safari Park Hotel, Telcom Kenya, USIU, and Brand Kenya.
luo: Sponsa mag nyasino ne gin KTN, Communications Authoriy of Kenyha, Anga Imax, Canon Kenya, French embassy, Kenya Broadcasting Corporation, Buzz, Kwese Inflix, Media Council of Kenya, Movie Mtaani, Pixel, Scoop Network, Safari Park Hotel, Telcom Kenya, USIU kod Brand Kenya.
mt0: <pad> The film's sponsors include KTN, Communications Authoriy of Kenyha, Anga Imax, Canon Kenya, French embassy, Kenya Broadcasting Corporation, Buzz, Kwese Inflix, Media Council of Kenya, Movie Mtaani, Pixel, Scoop Network, Safari Park Hotel, Telcom Kenya, USIU and Brand Kenya.</s>

en: Writer King’ori Gachoka was 22 years old when he first met celebrated author Francis Imbuga.
luo: Jandiko miluongo ni King'ori Gachoka ne jahigni 22 ka ne ohango romo gi jandiko mong'ere Francis Imbuga.
mt0: <pad> King'ori Gachoka was 22 years old when he was baptized by Francis Imbuga, the bishop of Lusaka.</s>

en: Things were so bad for the budding writer such that he could not afford a typewriter.
luo: Weche ne dhi maber ne jandiko maa pinyno kendo ne ok nyal kata ng'iewo typewriter.
mt0: <pad> Weche is a good man and he can write well and he can even use a typewriter.</s>

en: His script for a play had just been rejected by a local television station because it was handwritten, and he thought this could end his dream.
luo: Nitie tugo ma ne ondiko motero e TV, kata kamano jogo notamore nikech ne nondiko gi lwete kendo noparo ni mano e giko lek mare.
mt0: <pad> I went to the TV yesterday, but my friends were upset because I wrote it by hand and said that my hands were too wet.</s>

en: At the time, Gachoka was a student at Kenyatta University where the late Prof Imbuga, then 47 years old, was his dean, in the Arts Department.
luo: E kindeno, Gachoko ne en japuonjre e Kenyatta University kaman Profesa Imbuga ma ne jahigni 47 kindeno, ne en dean mare e Arts Department.
mt0: <pad> Currently, Gachoko is a professor at Kenyatta University alongside Prof Imbuga, who is 47 years old and the dean of the Arts Department.</s>

en: His frustrations led him to share the rejected piece with Imbuga with the aim of borrowing his typewriter.
luo: Nopimone Imbuga chandruok ma ne en-go ka dwache en ni Imbuga okonye gi typewriter.
mt0: <pad> I remember the day I wrote this letter to him.</s>

en: The professor was impressed with his work and allowed him to use his valuable Olympia Traveller DeLuxe portable typewriter.
luo: Profesano ne omor ahinya gima nondiko mi oyiene mondo oti gi masin mare ma nengone tek miluongo ni Olympia Traveller DeLuxe portable typewritter.
mt0: <pad> Professor, I'm very happy to see you and I'm so glad to see you.</s>

en: Yesterday, Gachoka, who will soon turn 47, could not hold back his tears as he parted with the typewriter, the same one that kick-started his career as well as Imbuga’s.
luo: Nyoro Gachoka, ma biro rwako higni 47 machiegni, ne oywako sama ne ochiwo typewriter ma ne en kachiel gi Imbuga ochakogo tich.
mt0: <pad> Nyoro Gachoka, 47, says he remembers his mother when she was a child and she couldn't find a typewriter.</s>

en: The typewriter will now be part of the exhibition of Imbuga’s literary works.
luo: Typewriter-no koro biro bedo achiel kuom gik mitang'o kinyiso tije Imbuga.
mt0: <pad> The typewriter is now a giant block of paper with a few hundred pages of text.</s>

en: “I took time to prepare myself because I knew it was not going to be an easy thing. So in July and August this year, I carried the typewriter to every meeting I attended and everywhere I went,” said Gachoka.
luo: Gachoka ne owacho kama, "Ne akawo thuolo mondo aikra maber nikech ne ang'eyo ni ok odhi bedo mayot chiwo. Omiyo e dwe mar Julai kod Agost higani, ne ating'oga typewriter-no e romo duto kod kamoro amora ma ne adhiye."
mt0: <pad> Gachoka said, "I started writing the book early because I knew it would be a long time. I was sleeping in my room between July and August, and I couldn't get my typewriter out of my bedroom.</s>

en: Gachoka, who spoke during the launch of the exhibition yesterday, reminisced the days when he was struggling. He also narrated how the professor surprised him when he returned the typewriter.
luo: Gachoka ma ne owuoyo nyoro e nyasi mitang'o tije Imbuga, ne owacho ni oparo ndalo ma ne ochandore. Nowacho gima profesa notimone ka ne oduokone typewriter.
mt0: <pad> When you talked to me in the morning before the arrival of the evening, you seemed to have broken your promise. You looked like a professor and a teacher while sitting at a typewriter.</s>

en: “It is yours now. I gave it to you,” said Imbuga to Gachoka’s amazement.
luo: Imbuga nonyise niya, "Koro en mari. Amiyogo." To mano kaka Gachoka ne omor.
mt0: <pad> Imbuga told him, "This is a man. I am not going to die."</s>

en: The typing machine, though slow, is still in good working condition.
luo: Kata obedo ni masin mar ndikono dhi mos, pod otiyo maber.
mt0: <pad> Although I know that you are a man, I can't tell you how to speak Chinese.</s>

en: Gachoka’s first literary work, a novel titled Divided Life, which thrust him into the  literature field, was produced using the type writer.
luo: Buk ma Gachoka nokwongo ndiko ne en sigana miluongo ni 'Divide Life' (Ngima Mopogore) ne omiyo ong'ere e kaka jandiko kendo bugno ne olos gi typewriter.
mt0: <pad> 'Divide Life' (Ngima Mopogore) e nkana wa Gachoka o na sigana miluongo ni 'Divide Life' (Ngima Mopogore) ne omiyo ong'ere e kaka jandiko kendo bugno ne olos gi typewriter.</s>

en: The novel saw him brush shoulders with big names in the industry such as Prof Egara Kabaji, who was present during the launch of the exhibition.
luo: Bugno nomiyo otudre gi ji ma nigi huma tij ndiko kaka Profesa Egara Kabaji ma ne obiro e nyasino.
mt0: <pad> Please don't know</s>

en: Standard Group Chief Executive Officer Orlando Lyomu, who was the chief guest, said the exhibition would give Kenyans an opportunity to interact with Imbuga’s thoughts.
luo: CEO mar Standard Group Orlando Lyomu ma ne en wendo modhial nowacho ni nyasino dhi miyo Jo-Kenya thuolo mar ng'eyo pach Imbuga.
mt0: <pad> CEO of Standard Group Orlando Lyomu, a good friend, said that the company was ready to invest in Kenyan-owned businesses.</s>

en: He said the media requires more content and called on those with ideas on drama to come up.
luo: Nowacho ni jofwambo dwaro paro manyien kendo nowacho ni jogo mong'eyo ndiko drama onego manye.
mt0: <pad> I think the audience wants to know and I think that this is a drama that everyone should know.</s>

en: “Do not shy away from partnering with us, this will help us continue mentoring talents in honour of the late Imbuga,” said Lyomu.
luo: Lyomu nowacho kama, "Kik iluor riwori kodwa, ma biro konyowa dhi nyime siro joma nigi mich ka waparogo Imbuga."
mt0: <pad> Lyomu said, "But I'm sorry, but I'll be going to the park on Sunday morning.</s>

en: To promote national heritage, Lyomu said, Standard Group will continue partnering with the Kenya National Archives, as it celebrates its heritage as the oldest media group in the region.
luo: Lyomu nowacho ni Standard Group siro kano weche mag piny kokalo kuom tiyo kanyachiel gi Kenya National Archives sama gitimo nyasi mar bedo od fwambo mosebudho aming'a moloyo moro amora.
mt0: <pad> Standard Group announced on Wednesday that it had published a report on the Kenya National Archives's records of the elections.</s>

en: Other guests present were Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology Vice Chancellor Fred Otieno and his Kenyatta University counterpart Paul Wainaina.
luo: Welo mamoko ma ne obiro ne en Vice Chancellor mar Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology, Fred Otieno kod Paul Wainaina mar Kenyatta University.
mt0: <pad> The academics who attended the ceremony were Vice Chancellor of Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology, Fred Otieno and Paul Wainaina of Kenyatta University.</s>

en: During the exhibition, Kenya National Archives will not charge the public. The exhibition will run until April 2019.
luo: E kinde ma nyasino dhi nyime, Kenya National Archives ok kwayo ji pesa mar donjo. Nyasino biro dhi nyime nyaka April 2019.
mt0: <pad> Before the building was completed, Kenya National Archives had not provided any funding for the construction. The building was completed in April 2019.</s>

en: Dubbed “An Exhibition of Prof Francis Imbuga’s Literary Works”, the gallery is a package of his entire life, containing photos from his days as an actor.
luo: Pinchnigo ondik ni ni "Ranyisi mag Gik ma Profesa Imbuga Nondiko" kendo pichni man kanyo nyiso ngimane duto, moriwo nyaka pichni mag ndalo ma ne en jatugo.
mt0: <pad> The inscription was written "Professor Imbuga's Last Written Work" and the inscription showed all the details, because he needed the inscription of the day he was writing.</s>

en: Imbuga’s works have become key in the study of literature schools in Kenya, with the most famous one being Betrayal in the City.
luo: Buge ma Imbuga ondiko itiyogo ahinya e skunde man Kenya ka buge mong'ere ahinya en Betrayal in the City.
mt0: <pad> The book is a popular Kenyan novel and one of the most read books in Kenya.</s>

en: It also has photos of his young family and those taken just before he died.
luo: Oting'o bende pichni mag jood Imbuga kod pichni ma ne ogoye ka pok otho.
mt0: <pad> I'm going to be a very good friend</s>

en: His other books include Aminata, Man of Kafira, The Burning of Rags and The Successor.
luo: Buge mamako ma ne ondiko gin: Aminata, Man of Kafira, The Burning of Rags kod The Successor.
mt0: <pad> The four books I have read are: Aminata, Man of Kafira, The Burning of Rags and The Successor.</s>

en: Imbuga’s works have consistently brought out issues that affect the society such as the clashes of modernity and tradition in the social organisation of African communities.
luo: Buge ma Imbuga ondiko kinde mang'eny wuoyo e wi chandruoge ma ji romogo kaka wach ma ji laro e wi kaka ji odak sani kod owinjore Jo Afrika dag kaluwore gi kitgi machon.
mt0: <pad> The newspaper is not a place for the debate of the political crisis but for the debate of the political crisis of the African people</s>

en: Gachoka, who spoke during the launch of the exhibition yesterday, reminisced the days when he was struggling.
luo: Gachoka ma ne owuoyo nyoro e nyasi mitang'o tije Imbuga, ne owacho ni oparo ndalo ma ne ochandore kaka jandiko.
mt0: <pad> When you talked to me on the morning of the arrival of the Empire, you said that you had been asleep and only used a bookcase.</s>

en: He also narrated how the professor surprised him when he returned the typewriter.
luo: Nowacho bende gima profesa notimone ka ne oduokone typewriter.
mt0: <pad> I remember when my professor told me that he had a typewriter.</s>

en: Young family
luo: Joode ka pod otin
mt0: <pad> simply say you don't know</s>

en: Dubbed “An Exhibition of Prof Francis Imbuga’s Literary Works”, the gallery is a package of his entire life, containing photos from his days as an actor.
luo: Pichnigo ondik ni "Ranyisi mag Gik ma Profesa Imbuga Nondiko" kendo pichni man kanyo nyiso ngimane duto, moriwo nyaka pichni mag ndalo ma ne en jatugo.
mt0: <pad> The painting was titled "Professor Imbuga's Last Written Work" and the front cover showed all the details, so he wanted the painting of his last day.</s>

en: It also has photos of his young family and those taken just before he died.
luo: Bende nitie pichni mag joode kod pichni ma ne ogoye ka pok otho.
mt0: <pad> I'm going to be a very good friend and I'll be very happy to see you.</s>

en: If we want to meet the dead looking alive we turn to art, said writer Hilary Mantel.
luo: Jandiko miluongo ni Hilary Mantel nowacho ni ka wadwaro neno jomotho ka joma ngima, onego wang'I pichni.
mt0: <pad> When Hilary Mantel said she was going to donate her life, I knew she was going to be a martyr.</s>

en: An exhibition on the life and times of the late satirical playwright Francis Imbuga hopes to do just that.
luo: Gik moket mineno manyiso ngima jandiko mong'ere Francis Imbuga biro nyiso adier mar wachno.
mt0: <pad> Francis Imbuga announced his resignation from the office of the Pope on Tuesday.</s>

en: The exhibition, which opens tomorrow at the Kenya National Archives will showcase Imbuga’s life in pictures, writings and mementos spanning from his grandparents who turned him into storyteller to fun times quaffing his favorite Tusker beer with friends at the Kenya National Theatre.
luo: Nyasi mar tang'o gigo dhi kiny e Kenya National Archives ka ginyiso pichni mag ngima Imbuga, buge ma ne ondiko kod gik miparego moa kuom kwerene mane omiyo obedo jasigana mang'ula kaka nomadhoga bia mar Tusker gi osiepene ka gin Kenya National Theatre.
mt0: <pad> The records of the Tusker riots were released by Kenya National Archives on Wednesday, showing the evidence of the riots and the safety of the site.</s>

en: Visitors will also be able to see original hand written manuscripts of his plays penned in an immaculate handwriting that his widow Prof Mabel Imbuga is still in awe of.
luo: Ibiro tang' ne welo bende tuke mane ondiko gi lwete owuon kendo chiege Profesa Mabel Imbuga pod okanoga otesego nyaka chil kawuono.
mt0: <pad> I'm going to be a professor for four years and I'll be a teacher for four years.</s>

en: “He had a very neat handwriting. He hardly made any mistakes and it’s something that really impresses me up to this day especially when I look at his first book,” she says.
luo: Chiege wacho kama, "Lwete ne ndiko maywayo wang'. Ne yot mondo otim ketho to mano gima mora nyaka kawuono sama arango buk ma ne okwongo ndiko."
mt0: <pad> Chiege said, "Thank you for your friendship. I'm sorry that you don't know me. I'll be waiting for you to come back."</s>

en: While numbers are projected to grow three-fold by 2023, that still represents a small fraction of the region’s population.
luo: Kata obedo ni geno nitie ni kwan biro medore di nya didek ka ochopo higa gana ariyo piero ariyo gi adek – 2023, mano pod ochungne kwan ji matin ma odak e piny jorotenge.
mt0: <pad> Although I have been told that the office building will be completed by 2023, I can't see how I can afford to build a new office building.</s>

en: Those figures make it clear that the region needs to address a major internet infrastructure shortfall.
luo: Kwan go nyiso ayanga ni pinjego dwarore ni mondo orang matut kaka nyalo medo gero gigo ma kelo tudruok mar mbuyi bedo mayot.
mt0: <pad> i'm sorry to see you looking at me like that</s>

en: The benefits of growing internet accessibility and access are obvious.
luo: Ber ma medruok mar tudruok gi weche mag mbuyi ong'ere maler.
mt0: <pad> I went to the school on Sunday and when I got there, I was very excited.</s>

en: In 2019, in Sub-Saharan Africa, more than 650 000 jobs were supported directly by the mobile ecosystem and more than 1.4-million informal jobs in 2019.
luo: E higa gana ariyo gi apar gochiko – 2019, e gwenge mag Sub-Saharan Africa, moloyo tije gana mia auchiel gi piero abich – 650,000 ne oyudore e weche mag tiyo gi sime; kendo ji ma ohingo 1,400,000 bende ne ondiki e tije mag ji giwegi.
mt0: <pad> In the year ending March 2019, in Sub-Saharan Africa, 650,000 people – mainly those with poor access to water – were affected by the flooding; and about 1,400,000 people also entered the water shortage crisis.</s>

en: It also contributed more than US$17-billion to public funding through the course of the year.
luo: Weche mag tudruok gi mbuyi no bende ne okelo medruok mar nyinyo mar jo America kod jo Ingeresa ma okalo tara gana apar gi abiriyo – 17,000,000.
mt0: <pad> The largest website in the world is probably the most popular site for children in America and England. It has 17,000,000 registered users.</s>

en: The International Telecommunication Union (ITU) has also established that a 10% increase in mobile broadband penetration in Africa would generate an increase of 2.5% in GDP per capita.
luo: Riwruok maduong ma ochung'ne weche tudruok mag mbuyi e piny mangima - The International Telecommunication Union (ITU) - ose lieko ni medruok maromo apar kuom mia achiel (10%) mag tudruok e yor mbuyi ei pinje mag jorotenge biro kelo medruok ma dirom kwan maromo ariyo gi sanja kuom mia (2.5%) e yuto mar piny owacho.
mt0: <pad> The International Telecommunication Union (ITU) - the world's biggest telecoms body - has already predicted that the growth of mobile phone services will contribute to the growth of mobile phone sales and almost two percent of the global income.</s>

en: That’s to say nothing of the benefits that better and more affordable mobile internet can have on education, healthcare, and government services.
luo: Mano ka ok wawuoye e ber ma tudruok mar mbuyi e yoo mayot biro kelo e weche mag somo, thieth kod yore ma piny owacho tiyogo ne jopiny.
mt0: <pad> I'm going to be a very good teacher, and I'll be very good at my job.</s>

en: With easily accessible internet connectivity, people can search for jobs, gain new skills, and access government services without having to travel to a physical location and potentially stand in long queues.
luo: Ka piny nyalo bedo gi tudruok mar mbuyi e yoo mayot, ji nyalo manyo tije, yudo tiegruok manyien maber kendo yudo konyruok kuom piny owacho ka ok gi dhi kunde ma joma tiyo ne piny owacho nitie kata chung mangeny kama joma dwaro konyruok kuom piny owacho chungie.
mt0: <pad> The water can be a source of nutrients in many different ways, it can be cleaned, cleaned well and cleaned from the water as it comes to you.</s>

en: As we have seen, the pandemic has caused economic and social devastation and changed the way we live, work, study and socialize, bringing about an era of social distancing.
luo: Kaka waseneno, yamo marach mar korona okelo chandruok e weche mag dongruok kod konyruok mar oganda nikech okelo pogruok e yoo ma wadakgo; kaka watiyo, kaka wasomo kendo kaka walalore gi jowetewa ma koro okelo ngima mar bedo mabor gi joma moko.
mt0: <pad> 'You know, the crown will bring a change to the laws of agriculture and gardening because it will make changes to your ways; you know, you learn and you understand the modern world that brings happiness to one man.</s>

en: One of the most significant changes is the acceleration of digital transformation.

en: African policymakers have realised that access to broadband is critical for mitigating the effects of the pandemic and boosting economic recovery in the post-Covid era.
luo: Joma loso chike e pinje mag Afrika osefwenyo ni tiyo kod yore mbuyi kelo pogruok maduong' e yor konyo weche ma yamo marach no okelo kendo medo tego dongruok mar piny bang ka Corona ose rumo.
mt0: <pad> Africa's largest loss of food has been proven to be the result of poor planning and management of food production, which will have a huge impact on the supply of food and fuel. The lack of a sustainable strategy for agricultural production will also have a significant impact on the supply of food and fuel in the region after the coronavirus outbreak is over.</s>

en: With changes in people’s behaviours and mindsets, broadband will also continue to provide opportunities for African countries to leapfrog obstacles to sustainable and inclusive socioeconomic development.
luo: Ka ji nyalo loko timbegi kod paro, weche mag tudruok e yor mbuyi bende biro medo kelo thuolo e pinje mag Afrika mar gik ma tamo dongruok mar oganda dhi nyime maber.
mt0: <pad> While you can't afford to buy a subscription, the weekly newsletter of the African Union is going to be published on Monday.</s>

en: Of course, the responsibility to create access doesn’t lie with government alone.

mt0: <pad> Yesterday, I felt like a man who was sitting on a table and watching the sun rise.</s>

mt0: <pad> For example, last year I started a digital school (DigiSchool) and taught about the importance of speaking to children with disabilities, while also teaching adults how to use technology to help them succeed.</s>

en: As response to the call to ensure that all South African school children can read fluently for meaning, the programme aims to connect more than 100 urban and rural primary schools to broadband internet.
luo: Kaluwore gi dwaro ni nyithindo ma somo e piny South Africa onge somo maber manyalo konyogi, lek mar chenrono en ni mondo moloyo nyithindo 100 ma somo e kuode ma lony nitie (town) kod e ngwenge man ei piny obed gi tudruok eyor mbuyi
mt0: <pad> The investigation claimed that South African children were not educated well and had poor literacy, but the report found that more than 100 schoolchildren from both towns and schools in the two countries on Wednesday were given a lesson in English.</s>

en: Additionally, we’ve rolled out DigiTrucks in several African countries, which enable everyone from students to entrepreneurs to learn how to use computers and connect with the digital world.
luo: Wach machielo en ni wase chako somo mar weche tudruok gi yor mbuyi ma waluongo gi dho ngere ni – DigiTrucks – e pinye mang'eny mag Afrika ma miyo ngato angata ka ochakore gi nyithindo masomo nyaka jo ohala; ma puonjogi kaka ginyalo tiyo gi kompyuta mondo gitudre gi ji ma odak e pinje ma oko.
mt0: <pad> DigiTrucks is a mobile education project in many African countries that has been designed to help children learn without having to go through the classroom; teaching them not only how to use computers but also how to read and write on their own when they are at home.</s>

en: For more than a decade, the United Nations has recognised that the internet is a catalyst for sustainable development.

en: Huawei is a leading global provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices.
luo: Huawei en kambi maduong' e piny mangima ma loso gigo ma itiyogo e tudruok e yoo mar mbuyi e piny ma ngima.
mt0: <pad> Huawei is a leading global technology company with a strong foundation in the field of mobile phone and wireless communication.</s>

en: With integrated solutions across four key domains – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services – we are committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.
luo: Ka watiyo gi yore ma opogore opogre e weche mag tudruok gi mbuyi machalo kaka e ong'we yamo (sime), weche mag tonde ma otudi ma keyo wach (IT), gik ma olosi gi rieko ma malo (smart devices) kod gigo ma kelo tudruok e kor boche polo (cloud services) – wan kod kinda mar kelo tudruok e yor mbuyi ne ngato angata, mier kod riwruoge mopogore opogore mondo mi wabed gi piny ma otudore duto kendo man gi rieko.
mt0: <pad> We have a wide variety of services that include mobile phone, information technology, smart devices and cloud services. We also have a range of different ways of providing services to customers with various levels of satisfaction, efficiency and flexibility to ensure that we are able to provide the best possible experience for our customers.</s>

en: Huawei's end-to-end portfolio of products, solutions and services are both competitive and secure.
luo: Gik ma Huawei loso kendo ma gitimo kod konyruok ma gi kelo nigi nengo maber kendo onge wach marach ma tiyo kodgi kelo e ngima dhano.
mt0: <pad> Huawei would like to thank you for the support and cooperation you have shown us.</s>

en: Through open collaboration with ecosystem partners, we create lasting value for our customers, working to empower people, enrich home life, and inspire innovation in organizations of all shapes and sizes.
luo: Kuom tiyo kanyakla gi jogo manie migao ma loso weche mag tudruok e piny, wamiyo jogo ma ngiewo gigewa (customers) gik maber ma miyo ji bedo gi teko kendo miyo ngima mar dala bedo maber kendo kelo paro manyien e kembe ma tindo kod madongo.
mt0: <pad> Through our company's efforts to provide the best quality products for customers, we offer a customer service that makes life easier and makes future living better and solve problems in the busy and crowded market.</s>

en: We invest heavily in basic research, concentrating on technological breakthroughs that drive the world forward.

mt0: <pad> They are very sensitive to the smell of a lot of foods and can cause serious problems like stomach pains and heartburn.</s>

en: We have more than 180,000 employees, and we operate in more than 170 countries and regions.

en: Founded in 1987, Huawei is a private company fully owned by its employees.
luo: Huawei en kambi mane ochaki e higa mar 1987 ma wegi gin joma tiyo kanyono.
mt0: <pad> Huawei is a Chinese company founded in 1987 as a provider of mobile phone network services.</s>

en: Te Asset Recovery Agency (ARA) has stepped up its push to recover Sh385 million from a businessman it accuses of siphoning the money from the County Government of Mandera.
luo: Bad piny owacho ma duoko mwandu mag jopiny koa kuom jok mane okawgi e yor mibadhi ma iluongo ni Asset Recovery Agency (ARA) ose medo kasore gi dwaro mar gi mar duoko ne piny owacho tara gana 385,000,000 mane ja ohala moro ne okwalo koa e piny owacho ma Mandera.
mt0: <pad> Bad debt recovery agency (ARA) has already rejected your request for a refund of 385,000,000 dollars which you have been able to pay in the Mandera bank.</s>

en: In submissions filed before the High Court, ARA claims that Ali Abdi Ibrahim cannot explain the source of the Sh385 million found in his two accounts and that the investigations have revealed the money was acquired from three companies that traded with the county government.
luo: Kaluwore gi wach ma gitero e doho mamalo e Kenya, ARA wacho ni jago ma iluongo ni Ali Abdi Ibrahim ok nyal lero kama ne oyude omenda maromo 385,000,000 mane oyudi e akaunt ariyo ma okane pesa ne. ARA wacho ni nonro mar gi nyiso ni pesani ne oa e kembe moko adek mane timo ohala gi piny owacho ma Mandera.
mt0: <pad> The Associated Press Agency of Kenya (ARA) reported today that a politician named Ali Abdi Ibrahim was arrested on Tuesday after he admitted stealing the money from two bank accounts.</s>

en: State counsel Jennifer Gitiri representing the agency argued that an analysis of Ibrahim’s accounts showed a systematic pattern of money laundering where some of the amounts were deposited in cash while others were wired from other banks.
luo: Okil ma ochungne piny owacho miluongo ni Jennifer Gitiri ne owacho e od bura ni kaluwore gi nonro mar gi e kunde keno mar Ibrahim, ne giyudo ni ne nitie kaka ne ja mibadhino tero pesa e kar keno magego kendo moko bende ne iorone ka oaye kuonde keno mamoko.
mt0: <pad> Jennifer Gitiri, who was a former actress and a former presenter of the show, said she had been involved in the show for years and that she had always been a very generous woman.</s>

en: “The amounts are proceeds of crime that must be forfeited to the state. He has failed to prove how and why the suspicious cash transactions were deposited in his account. He cannot even show evidence of any business he transacted with the county government of Mandera,” said Gitiri.
luo: Gitiri ne owacho kama, "Nikech omenda go ne oyudi e yor mibadhi, ibiro duok gi ne piny owacho. Ok nyal lero maber kaka kendo gima omiyo omenda ma nenore ni ne ok onwang’ e yo ma oriere go ne ochopo e kar keno mare. Ok onyal golo gima nyiso ni ne otimo ohala gi piny owacho ma Mandera."
mt0: <pad> Gitiri said, "Ndi ndamu e yo ma oriere go ne ochopo e kar keno mare. Ndo nyal lero maber kaka kendo gima omiyo omenda ma nenore ni ne ok onwang’ e yo ma oriere go ne ochopo e kar keno mare. Ndo nyal golo gima nyiso ni ne otimo ohala gi piny owacho ma Mandera."</s>

en: According to ARA, the huge amounts are suspected to have been stolen from the county government of Mandera and deposited to Ibrahim’s accounts to conceal the source when he has no legitimate businesses to generate the total amount.
luo: Kalowore gi nonro mane otim gi KARA, kwan mageny go iparo ni ne okwal ka ooye piny owacho mar Mandera kendo ne oket gi e kar keno mar Ibrahim mondo kik fwenyre kama ne ogol gie nikech ngatni ne onge ohala ma ongere mane otimo mane nyalo miye pesa ma chal kamano.
mt0: <pad> Please tell me how you did it, and I'll tell you how you did it.</s>

en: Ms Gitiri submitted that the cash was being deposited in his account by unknown people and even after being summoned to explain, he could not tell where the money came from.
luo: Nyadendi Gitiri ne ondiko ni kwan go ne ikete e kar keno mar ngat miluongo ni Ibrahim no gi ji ma ok oyangore maber kendo kane oluonge mondo oler kama pesa go ne owuokie to ne ok onyal lero maber kama ne gi aye
mt0: <pad> The elderly man said that the road was closed and he had to go through the entire city.</s>

en: She said some of the cash deposit were made in tranches of below Sh1 million to avoid raising suspicion and that records at the Kenya Revenue Authority showed that he did not pay any taxes to prove he was trading with the county government.
luo: Nyadendino ne owacho ni moko kuom kwan go ne oket e bengi mar keno mar ngatno mos mos kar pesa ma ok oromo tara gana achiel (1,000,000) mondo kik paro moro bedie ni ne gin mag miganga kendo jo sol osuru ma Kenya ma iluongo ni Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) ne oyango ni jalno ne ok ochulo osuru manyiso ni ne en gi ohala mane ogoyo gi piny owacho ma Mandera no.
mt0: <pad> Mandera says that one of the roads he has been using to get into Kenya is a highway that was built by a private company and that it was designed to be used for agriculture and manufacturing.</s>

en: “Without any evidence to substantiate the source of his funds, we are left with only one conclusion that they are proceeds of crime. His defence that he was sub-contracted by other companies to do construction work are baseless and lies meant to hoodwink the court,” said Gitiri.
luo: “Ka onge gima nyiso kama pesa go ne oaye, wadong mana gi neno achiel kende ni pesa go ne oyudie e yo mar miganga. Wach ma owacho ni ne omiye kibaruwa ma bathe gi kembe ma moko mag gedo onge tiende kendo mirambo lilo ma odwa wuondo go od bura”.
mt0: <pad> "I don't know if the money is really there, I just heard it from the ear of an angel. The claim that he has given me a request to buy the mattresses for my elderly mother is untrue and the fireworks that he has burned are not worth the price."</s>

luo: Kambi mar jo Equity Group oloso ohala ka gise golo chudo mar osuru maromo tara gana aboro gi abiriyo (Sh8.7 billion). Ma otimore e dweche adek ma okuongo mar higa 2021 ka opim gi kinde ma chal kamano e higa ma okalo. Kambi no mar hola nyocha owacho chieng tich adek.
mt0: <pad> Equity Group plc ohala ka gise abiriyo (Sh8.7 billion) i mweche adek ma okuongo 2021 ka opim gi kinde ma chal kamano e higa ma okalo.</s>

en: The Group registered a balance sheet expansion of 54 per cent to reach Sh1.07 trillion driven by a 58 per cent growth in customer deposits underpinned by Sh140 billion shareholders’ funds.
luo: Kambini ne okelo medruok ma romo piero abich agwen – 54 e wi 100 ma ne omiyo gichopo tara gana gana gana achiel gi abiriyo (1.07 trillion) mane obiro nikech medruok mar jogo ma keno kodgi maromo 58 e wi 100 ka omedore gi pesa mar weg kambino maromo tara gana mia achiel kod piero apar agwen – 140,000,000.
mt0: <pad> The company said it had a net profit of 54 percent on the 100th percentile which was lower than the previous year's 58 percentile because of its higher earnings and lower costs.</s>

en: A liquid balance sheet with Sh500 billion of cash, cash equivalents and government securities reflect the agility to redeploy funding seamlessly as the economies recover from the adverse impact of the Covid-19 multi-crisis.
luo: Pesa man tiere ma romo tara gana gana mia abich (500 billion) kod mago ma ool piny owacho nyiso ni pesa nyalo keyore e piny mondo oger dongruok mar piny bang kethruok mageny ma otimore ka okel gi tuo yamo mar Corona.
mt0: <pad> The massive emergency fund of 500 billion dollars announced by the world's central bank shows that the world can afford to cope with the global economic downturn caused by the coronavirus pandemic.</s>

en: “Our strategy; purpose-first, inclusivity, affordability, reach, agility and quality have proven resilient and sustainable” said Dr James Mwangi, the Equity Group CEO while releasing the first quarter of 2021 financial results. “Purpose has proved profitable” he added.
luo: “Kaluwore gi gik moteno weche wa machalo kaka watimo chenro wa, gima omiyo wagoyo ohala ni, tiyo kanyakla, keto nengo ma yot, jogo ma wanyalo chopo ir gi, temo loso gigewa mapiyo kod timo tich ma maber ose miyo wa kinda mar tich kod medo dhi nyime maber”. Ajuoga James Mwangi ma en e jatelo maduong mar Equity Group ne owacho chieng mane ogolo kaka weche mag pesa mar kar keno no chalo e dweche adek ma okongo e higa mar 2021. “Gima omiyo ne ochak Equity Group okelo ohala”. Ne obedo wacho.
mt0: <pad> The chief executive of Equity Group James Mwangi said the company was ready to take action on the crisis. He said that the company had been able to operate without any financial difficulties since the pandemic began in March.</s>

en: During the multi-crisis year, Equity focused on social impact investment in health investing Sh1.7 billion in social response to society, forgoing Sh1.5 billion in waived mobile transaction fees, waiving Sh1.2 billion in loan rescheduling fees and accommodating Sh171 billon (or 31 per cent) of the loan book for up to 3 years of principal and interest repayment breaks to enable businesses to survive.
luo: E higa ma nyocha weche mangeny obet matek, kambi mar Equity nyocha otemo keto mwandu gi e yor konyo ji e weche mag ngiyo ngima dhano; ne gitiyo gi kwan maromo tara gana gana achiel kod abiriyo (1.7 billion) e konyo ji kendo ne giweyo choko pesa kuom joma keno kodgi ma golo pesa e yoo mar sime maromo tara gana achiel gi sanja (1.5 billion). Kambino bende ne oweyo ne jo ohala pesa mar choro duoko pesa mane gi holo nyime maromo tara gana gana achiel gi ariyo (1.2 billion). Kendo ne giweyo tara gana gana mia achiel kod piero abiro gi achiel (171 billion) bemde kendo ne giweyo pesa maromo 31 e wi 100 mar pesa mane ool kuom higini adek maonge chudo mar duoko nyinyo kod pesa ma onyuolo mondo omi ohala odhi nyime.
mt0: <pad> When the Equity Committee reviewed the financial statements of the company, it found that the company had spent 1.7 billion dollars on water and 1.5 billion dollars on investments in infrastructure and growth. It also said that the company had a deficit of 1.2 billion dollars on debt repayments and a deficit of 1.5 billion dollars on loans to retirees. It also said that the company had a deficit of 171 billion dollars per day and 31 percent of 100 percent of its share of the stock market for the first quarter of the year.</s>

en: “We kept the lights of the economies we operate in on, supported businesses to repurpose, retool and recover by supporting livelihoods of our customers during the crisis”, said Dr Mwangi.
luo: Ne watemo neno ni taya mar nwengo mar piny omedo oliel ka wa konyo jo ohala mondo obed gi paro manyien kendo oyud gige tich mondo gi chung motegno kendo ka wakonyo joma keno kodwa e diere ma weche tekgi.
mt0: <pad> I know that my mother's wife is a very good mother and she has been very kind to me.</s>

en: He added, “We have adopted a two-pronged strategy of being offensive and defensive. en: Previously known as sales tax, VAT is levied at consumption at a maximum rate of 16 per cent.

en: “They merely indicated figures which may have included sold stock and this may be unfair and unjust enrichment on their part since the inclusion of sold stock in the figures would mean that the petitioners would benefit by getting input tax relief from the first respondent - Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) - for tax already passed on to consumers,” said Justice Korir in his May 31 ruling.

en: Refunding VAT paid for raw materials has been a subject of numerous litigation between the taxman and taxpayers, with the government allocating Sh10 billion for the payment of “verified” VAT refund claims.

en: Universal Corporation Ltd, Elys Chemical Industries Ltd and Dawa Ltd had on December 5, 2017, petitioned the court to declare that they were entitled to VAT refunds, which they had paid for the raw materials bought for their supplies that had until September 2015 had been tax-exempt.

mt0: <pad> The companies which include Universal Corporation Ltd, Elys Chemical Industries Ltd and Dawa Ltd have lodged a legal action with the Kenyan High Court on 5th December 2017 asking for an extension of the VAT exemption period which was extended from 2015 to 2016 and then extended to 2018.</s>

en: A tax-exempt item is not part of any tax calculations, which is why the manufacturers could not claim input tax.

en: If a good or business is “exempt”, the government doesn’t tax the sale of the good, but producers cannot claim a credit for the VAT they pay on inputs to produce it.

mt0: <pad> As a result, they are not allowed to charge taxes on their goods. However, they do not allow them to charge taxes on their goods.</s>

en: For a zero-rated good, the government does not tax its sale, but allows credits for the value-added paid on inputs.

en: However, the Finance Act of 2015 moved these supplies from a tax-exempt status to zero-rated.

mt0: <pad> But, the latest law by Piny Owachona in October 2015 stipulates that Kenya has adopted a number of measures to ensure that taxpayers can easily afford the basic necessities of their income taxes, including the provision that taxpayers must pay the basic taxes themselves.</s>

en: A section of the VAT Act, 2013 stipulated that wherein future legislation the exempt supplies become taxable after a person had incurred input VAT, the person could claim VAT as long as the claim is lodged within three months from the date the exempt supply become zero-rated.

mt0: <pad> The Provisional Tax Act of 2013 says that the tax must be deducted from the goods to prevent the tax from being charged when it is due, but the KRA should recognize that the tax has been deducted from the goods before the day of the deadline and that the tax has been deducted from the goods as the tax has been charged.</s>

en: “Parliament was clear that it did not want taxpayers to recover reliefs from supplies that had already been made and which were previously exempt supplies,” said Justice Korir.

en: I recently stumbled upon an old photo showing a long and meandering queue of taxpayers outside Times Tower, Nairobi, waiting to submit their annual tax returns.
luo: Nyocha apo ka arodhno gi picha moro ma nyiso kaka ji yande riedo e laini mabor oko mar od solo osur ma iluongo ni Times Towers, Nairobi, ka girito mondo gi chiw duoko mag gi mar chulo osuru.
mt0: <pad> The investigation was based on a photo of a man lying on the ground near the Times Towers in Nairobi, Kenya, and a woman standing on the ground near the building.</s>

en: Although the photo is not dated, it could have been years back before the Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) automated filing of tax returns.
luo: Kata obedo ni picha no onge gi tarik, onyalo bedo higni ma machon ka ne bad Piny Owacho ma solo osuru – Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) ne pok oketo timo tije gi e yor mbuyi.
mt0: <pad> Although the picture is a historical one, it's not very good.</s>

en: The long queue could have meant two things.
luo: Laini ma bor ni ne nyalo nyiso gik moko ariyo:
mt0: <pad> I believe that I can do two things.</s>

en: It was either the last day or a few days to end of June when submission of annual tax returns falls due.
luo: Ne onyalo bedo odiechieng’ ma ogik or ndalo matin ka due mar Auchiel pok orumo ma owinjore obedi ni ngato ka ngato ooro e duoko ne mar chulo osuru e hik sirikal ma rumo e dwe mar Auchiel no.
mt0: <pad> When you are sleeping in the morning, you should be aware that the early morning sun is shining and the evening sun is rising.</s>

en: The situation in that photo got me wondering, what would have happened if submission of annual tax returns was still manual at this time when physical engagements have been restricted as part of the Covid-19 containment measures?
luo: Gima ne aneno e picha no ne okawa gi wuoro; ang’o ma de otimore ka de bed ni ooro duoko mar solo osuru pod ne itero gi ji ma ok e yoo mbuyi ahinya sani ma idwaro ni ji kik rom mang’eny nikech wach tuo mar Corona?
mt0: <pad> I knew that the photo was taken when the okawa was empty; what happened to me while I was sleeping in my bed was that the water was so clean that the faucets were filled with water before I decided that the water supply would be cut down due to the coronavirus pandemic.</s>

en: Would this have called for taxpayers to line up at KRA offices in shifts to submit their tax returns?
luo: Iparo ni ma ne nyalo miyo jo sol osuru kone gi ni mondo ipang laini bang’ grup ka grup ka gi ooro ripot osuru gi?
mt0: <pad> I couldn't tell you why I was so upset with the report.</s>

en: How safe would this have been for the taxpayers and KRA staff?
luo: Iparo ni timo kamano de obedo ma onge rach ma nyalo wuoke kuom jo sol osuru kachiel gi jo tich mar KRA?
mt0: <pad> I would like to know how much money I can get from the KRA officials who are in charge of the investigation.</s>

en: Thankfully, the iTax system is in place.
luo: Gima duong’ en ni ooro duoko mar solo osuru sani itimo gi e yor mbuyi (internet) ka okale chenro ma KRA luongo ni iTax system.
mt0: <pad> iTax system is a very good idea and i am very happy to see it.</s>

en: iTax is a self-service system that enables taxpayers to conduct tax business such as personal identification number (PIN) registration, tax payment, ledger maintenance, application for tax compliance certificates and waiver application, among others.
luo: iTax en chenro ma ngato timo gimoro amora kende. Ma miyo jo sol osuru timo weche mag chiwo duoko kaka ng'ato osolo osuru machalo – dwaro namba ma ichiwo gi KRA – PIN, chulo osuru, neno ni ikano weche ni mag solo osuru maber, dwaro barua ma nyiso ni ise bedo ka ichulo osuru maber, kwayo mondo oweni chulo osuru gi mamoko.
mt0: <pad> iTax is a simple system that doesn't require any additional work. It only requires a few steps to file taxes – request the KRA-PIN, pay the tax, check that the tax is correctly filed, request a letter showing that you are a taxpayer, and then pay the tax by hand.</s>

en: Taxpayers can do all these from the comfort of their homes or offices.
luo: Sani jo sol osuru nyalo timo magi duto ka gin e ute gi kata e ofis ma ok gidhi ka KRA.
mt0: <pad> Sani jo sol osuru nyalo timo magi duto ka gin e ute gi kata e ofis ma ok gidhi ka KRA.</s>

en: The iTax system is especially handy at this moment when taxpayers are filing their 2020 annual tax returns.
luo: Yoo ma ichiwo go duoko mar chulo osuru - iTax system sani koro ber ahinya sama koro ji chiwo duoko mag gi mar chulo osuru e higa 2020.
mt0: <pad> I've been using the iTax system for a long time and it's very convenient to use.</s>

en: It minimises physical engagements which go a long way in helping flatten the curve.
luo: Omiyo ji ok rom pile kaka chon ma konyo e yor duoko tuo mar Corona piny.
mt0: <pad> I'm going to be a few days away from the Corona virus.</s>

en: Safaricom CEO, Peter Ndegwa holds the 2020 Global Mobile (GLOMO) Award, awarded to Safaricom by Global Systems for Mobile Communications Associations (GSMA) in recognition of Safaricom's outstanding contribution to the mobile industry.
luo: Jatend kambi mar Safaricom Peter Ndegwa sani koro nigi mich mar 2020 Global Mobile (GLOMO) Award ma omi Safaricom koa kuom riwruok mar piny mangima mar simbe ong'we yamo ma iluongo gi dho ngere ni Global Systems for Mobile Communications Associations (GSMA) ma puoyo tich maber ma Safaricom ose timo e tedruok mar ogwe yamo.
mt0: <pad> Peter Ndegwa, CEO of Safaricom, has been named the 2020 Global Mobile (GLOMO) Award winner by the Global Systems for Mobile Communications Associations (GSMA) which recognised the efforts of Safaricom to transform the mobile market in Africa.</s>

en: Safaricom can now tap into the lucrative Ethiopian market after the country awarded an operating licence to a consortium that is led by the Kenyan telco.
luo: Safaricom koro nyalo tiyo e piny Ethopia ka piny no nyocha omiyo riwruok mar kembe ong'we yamo barua ma oyiene gi tich e piny no ka otel negi kod kambi man Kenya ma iluongo ni telco.
mt0: <pad> Safaricom can now operate in Ethiopia after the country announced its independence on Wednesday after a letter of agreement was signed by the company in an hotel in Addis Ababa, Kenya.</s>

en: This paves the way for the company’s expansion into Ethiopia, which has massive opportunities for growth owing to its over 112 million population.
luo: Ma omiyo kambi mar Safaricom no thuolo mar yaro bade nyaka Ethopia ma biro miyo omed dongruok nikech Ethopia nigi kwan mar ji maromo tara gana 112,000,000.
mt0: <pad> Ma omiyo kambi mar Safaricom no thuolo mar yaro bade nyaka Ethopia ma biro miyo omed dongruok nikech Ethopia nigi kwan mar ji maromo tara gana 112,000,000.</s>

en: This comes following a decision by the Ethiopian government to award the bid for a second nationwide telecommunication licence to a consortium that includes Safaricom and parent companies Vodacom Group of South Africa and Vodafone Group of UK.
luo: Ma otimore bang’ Piny Owacho ma Ethopia nyocha oneno ni gichiw barua mar ariyo mar medo keyo ongwe yamo e piny no ne riwruok mar kembe mag ogwe yamo ma achiel kuom gi en Safaricom kanyakla gi kembe mane onyuole - Vodacom Group mar South Africa kod Vodafone Group man UK.
mt0: <pad> The Ethiopian Communications Corporation (ECP) has announced that it has signed the second letter of approval for its mobile phone network in the country and that it will acquire the majority share of the company in the Safaricom Group, which is owned by four other companies - Vodacom Group of South Africa and Vodafone Group of the UK.</s>

en: “The Ministry of Finance and the Ethiopian Communications Authority warmly welcome the award of one new telecommunication licence to the Global Partnership for Ethiopia, a private consortium of Safaricom (Kenya), Vodafone Group (UK), Vodacom Group (South Africa), DCD Group (UK) and Sumitomo Corporation (Japan) and Development Finance Cooperation (DFC) today,” said the country’s minister of finance in a statement yesterday.
luo: Migawo ma ochung'ne weche omuom e Ethopia kod bad sirikand no ma ochung ne weche mag tudruok e yor mbuyi nyo orwako gi mor chiwo barua mar tich ne riwruok machielo manyien ma olosi gi kembe ong'we yamo ma giluongo ni Global Partnership for Ethiopia ma otingo Safaricom (Kenya), Vodafone Group (UK), Vodacom Group (South Africa), DCD Group (UK) kod Sumitomo Corporation (Japan) ka achiel gi  Development Finance Cooperation (DFC) kawuono.” Ma nyo owachi gi minista mar pesa e piny Ethopia e barua ma burua ma nyo kete koke.
mt0: <pad> The agreement was signed on Wednesday by the Global Partnership for Ethiopia, a consortium of five companies that include Safaricom (Kenya), Vodafone Group (UK), Vodacom Group (South Africa), DCD Group (UK), Sumitomo Corporation (Japan) and Development Finance Cooperation (DFC).</s>

en: According to senior government officials who spoke to news agencies, the consortium placed a USD850 million (Sh85 billion) bid to bag the licence.
luo: Kaluwore gi ler ma jo dongo matiyo e sirikal ochiwo ne jo fwap weche, riwruok mar kembe ma sani dwa chako tich Ethopia ne oket tara gana 85,000,000,000 mondo mi giyud burua mar tich.
mt0: <pad> The earthquake that hit the Earth on Wednesday was a massive explosion that killed about 85,000,000,000 people in the southern part of the earth.</s>

en: The Safaricom consortium pledged to invest another Sh800 billion over the next 10 years to roll out telecommunication services.
luo: Jog ma oriwore gi Safaricom nyocha oketo singo mar golo kendo kwan maromo pesa jo Kenya 800,000,000.
mt0: <pad> The agreement includes the sale of the mobile phone network and the acquisition of the Kenyan telephone company.</s>

en: “Global Partnership for Ethiopia is a consortium of reputable telecom companies providing service to over 750 million customers all over the world and committed to create new jobs, support the economy through introduction of new and efficient services,” said Ethiopia Communications Authority (ECA) Director General Balcha Reba.
luo: “Global Partnership for Ethopia en winjruok mar kembe ma ongere mag ogwe yamo m sani nigi jo ngiepo ma romo million 75 (75,000,000,000) e piny mangima; gin kembe ma temo mondo oyaw kunde ma ginyalo ndiko ji tich ka gikonyo e yor dongruok e piny kuom kelo yore manyien mag timo tich.” Ma nyo owachi gi jatelo mar bad sirikal mangiyo yore tudruok e piny Ethopia (Ethiopia Communications Authority (ECA) Migosi Balcha Reba.
mt0: <pad> Global Partnership for Ethiopia is a new fundraising initiative that has been launched today as a 75 million dollar (75,000,000,000) aid to the country; it is a fundraising initiative that is designed to create jobs and help the country's economy by providing employment training and skills."</s>

en: “I am also very pleased the consortium will invest $8 billion over the next ten years.”
luo: “Bende amor ni winjruok mar jo sim ogwe yamo no biro kelo e piny Ethopia kwan maromo pesa jo America million 8 (8,000,000,000) e higni 10 ma biro.”
mt0: <pad> "I knew that the Ethiopian government was going to spend 8 million dollars (8,000,000,000) and 10 years of work in the coming year."</s>

en: A customer holds a 3G prepaid sim card after buying the service from an Ethio-Telecom shop in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.

mt0: <pad> I've just bought a 3G Sim Card from the store of Ethio-Telecom in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.</s>

en: The decision by ECA comes less than a month after the state regulator received two bids for two licences to roll out nationwide operations under the new market structure.
luo: Neno mar ECA mondo omi winjruok mar kembe mag ogwe yamo burua mar tich timore kapok dwe achiel orumo nyaka ne bad sirikal no yudi kwayo ariyo mar chiwo barua mar tich e bwo chik mane giketo manyien no.

en: Securing the bid further puts Safaricom ahead of regional competitors MTN that bid for the licence alongside state-run Ethio Telecom.
luo: Yudo barua mar tich Ethopia kono omiyo Safaricom sani kor ni nyime ne kekbe mogo ma gi pimore e chiro machalo MTN ma bende dwaro burua machal kamano kachiel gi kambi mar sirikal ma Ethopia ma iluongo ni Ethio Telecom.
mt0: <pad> The letter from the Ethiopian government to Safaricom was sent to me today and I am pleased that they have agreed to sign a contract with the state-run telecoms company of Ethiopia called Ethio Telecom.</s>

en: “With over $8 billion total investment, this will be the single largest foreign direct investment into Ethiopia to date,” said Ethiopia’s Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed.
luo: “Keto kwan maromo pesa jo America million 8 (800,000,000) biro bedo pesa ma okongo biro Ethopia dichiel ma oa oko kuom jogo ma dwa timo ohala e Ethopia nyaka sirikand Ethopia chakre.” Ja tend sirikand Ethopia – Prime Minister – Abiy Ahmed nyo owacho kamano.
mt0: <pad> “Ket o kwan maromo pesa jo America million 8 (800,000,000) biro bedo pesa ma okongo biro Ethopia dichiel ma oa oko kuom jogo ma dwa timo ohala e Ethopia nyaka sirikand Ethopia chakre.” Ja tend sirikand Ethopia – Prime Minister – Abiy Ahmed nyo owacho kamano.</s>

en: Our desire to take Ethiopia fully digital is on track.

mt0: <pad> The country of Ethiopia is a land of the people who have been given the name of the ancient kingdom of the kings.</s>

en: Global service providers have been waiting in anticipation for the liberalisation of Ethiopia’s telecommunications market that began more than three years ago when the Council of Ministers agreed to partial privatisation of Ethio Telecom and the issuance of two other operating licences.
luo: Kembe mag ogwe yamo matiyo e piny magima ose bet ka rito gi geno mondo piny Ethopia oyaw thuolo ne jo go ohala e yor ogwe yamo mane ochalkore higni adek ma ose kalo kane bura mar jotend migepe owinjore ni sirikal owe jomoko ongiew kaka ginyalo bedo jo kanyono e kambi sirikal miluongo ni Ethio Telecom kendo chiwo barupe ariyo ne joma dwa timo ohala mag weche tudruok.
mt0: <pad> Ethiopian government has been planning to introduce a new telecoms network in the country.</s>

en: Ethio Telecom had 50.7 million subscribers as at January 2021, including 23.5 million data and internet users as well as 309,000 and 981,000 fixed broadband and fixed service subscribers respectively.
luo: Kar dwe mar Achiel 2021, Ethio Telecom ne nigi jo ngiepo maromo 50.7 million ka oriw gi 23.5 million ma tiyo gi sime kod joma tiyo gi yor mbuyi (internet) maromo 309,000 kod joma tiyo gi yore mamoko makwan gi romo 981,000.
mt0: <pad> According to the report, by April 2021, Ethio Telecom had 50.7 million mobile phone customers and 23.5 million landline and 309,000 internet and 981,000 mobile data customers.</s>

en: While inviting bids at the end of last year, ECA said service providers needed to comply with strict technical and financial qualifications to demonstrate the company had the capacity to manage a licence of its scale.
luo: Ka ne gi luongo kembe mondo oor kwayo gi mar goyo ohala e piny Ethopia e yore manyien mar tudruok, ECA ne owacho ni kembe ma goyo ohala machal kamano nyaka nyis ni gin gi lony maber kod pesa malongo ma nyalo miyo gi timo tich maber ma oromo gi barua ma ibiro migi.
mt0: <pad> When they launched the first humanitarian aid project in Ethiopia in June, the ECA said that the project was a demonstration of the urgency of a new strategy and funding mechanism to provide a new framework for the work of the organization.</s>

en: “Under these licences, service providers will have the right to provide any telecommunication service, including voice, text and data using any technology whether fixed or wireless anywhere within Ethiopia and to send and receive telecommunications to and from outside Ethiopia,” said the authority in its call for bids.
luo: “Kuom barua ma ibiro migi no, weg kembe go biro bedo gi thuolo mar timo tiche ma opogore opogore ma tiyo gi waya kod ma ok ti gi waya ei Ethiopia, manyalo bedo gi tudruok jok man oko mar Ethiopia,” Bad piny owacho ne ondiko kamano e sama ne gi luongo ji mondo oor kwayo gi.
mt0: <pad> "In my letter, I explained that the office is responsible for the various kinds of violence that has been committed in and outside Ethiopia, and that they are responsible for the prevention of violence in Ethiopia," Bad piny said.</s>

en: The winning consortium will be allowed an initial licence term of at least 15 years with the possibility of renewal.

en: The consortium allows the firm to leverage on the resources of its parent company to roll out its suite of products that have proven hugely successful in the Kenyan market.

en: According to Safaricom’s latest financial results for the year ended December 31, 2020, the company recorded Sh289 billion in revenue from M-Pesa Global, a 54 per cent increase compared to Sh164.7 billion recorded in 2019.
luo: Kaluwore gi chal mar Safaricom kaka ondiki e repod gi mar higa ma Tarik 31.12.2020, kambino ne oyudo milionde 289 (289 billion) mane gi loso e MPESA ma itiyo e piny mangima; ma ne en medruok mar tara gana 164.7 (billion) kuom pesa mane gi yudo e higa 2019.
mt0: <pad> The latest financial report by Safaricom for the year to 31 December 2020 shows that the company has lost 289 billion shillings (289 billion) in its foreign exchange losses; which is a tax bill of 164.7 billion shillings (billions) of the total revenue it lost in the year.</s>

en: M-Pesa Global was created following a reorganisation that saw Safaricom and Vodacom acquire full control of the mobile money brand.
luo: MPESA Global ne oloso bang’ lokruok mane obede ka Safaricom kod Vodacom ne koro okawe kaka mar gi.
mt0: <pad> MPESA Global has already completed four deals with Safaricom and Vodacom and is now just yours.</s>

en: The suspects are said to have promised to help the job seekers to secure jobs with, among other organisations, the National Police Service, National Intelligence Service (NIS), Kenya Ports Authority (KPA), and other government parastatals.

en: Police in Nairobi are searching for a senior prisons officer implicated in a Sh200 million fake jobs racket.
luo: Okwach kich ma Nairobi sani dwaro ja ditto moro ma tiyo gi joka jela ma chilo mieno e wach pesa maromo miliion 200 (200,000,000) e wach mar wuondo ji ni omanyo negi tije
mt0: <pad> Nairobi Chief Magistrate's Court on Monday sentenced the former president to two years in jail and a fine of 200 million shillings (200,000,000.00) for his alleged role in the embezzlement of money.</s>

en: Two suspects have been arrested and are helping the DCI with investigations.

en: The officer is said to have conned hundreds of desperate job seekers of their hard-earned cash, in the pretext that they could help them secure jobs in Government.
luo: Jatelo ma tiyo ka Jela no iwacho ni ne okawo masowa gir joma ng’eny ma manyo tije ka onyiso gi ni obiro yudo negi tich e piny owacho (sirikal).
